skill.name: ux-audit
skill.description: Perform comprehensive UX audits on pages, components, or features. Use when the user asks to "audit UX", "review usability", "evaluate the interface", "UX review", or wants a systematic evaluation of user experience quality.
skill.summary: Audit interfaces using Nielsen's heuristics to identify usability issues and improve user experience.
skill.author: Dami-Randle

security_audit.summary: All 16 static findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation and markdown content for UX auditing. The 'hardcoded URL' is legitimate GitHub source metadata. 'Backtick execution' findings are markdown code formatting syntax. No cryptographic algorithms or malicious code exists. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Poor user experience leads to user abandonment and reduced engagement. This skill performs systematic UX audits using established heuristics to identify issues and recommend improvements before release.
actual_capabilities: Evaluate interfaces against Nielsen's 10 usability heuristics
Identify critical usability issues with prioritized recommendations
Assess visual hierarchy and content clarity
Check interaction patterns and error recovery
Generate structured audit reports with scores
limitations: Does not perform automated accessibility testing (use accessibility-check skill)
Does not modify code or implement changes
Cannot evaluate actual user behavior (requires user testing)
Relies on provided interface descriptions or mockups

use_cases.title: Pre-release interface review
use_cases.description: Systematically evaluate new features or pages before launch to catch usability issues early.
use_cases.target_user: Product designers and developers preparing releases

use_cases.title: Technical debt assessment
use_cases.description: Identify accumulated usability issues in legacy features and prioritize improvements.

use_cases.title: Quick sanity check
use_cases.description: Get a rapid high-level UX assessment during agile sprints.
use_cases.target_user: Developers and designers in sprint cycles

prompt_templates.title: Basic audit request
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a UX audit of the [page/component/feature] using Nielsen's heuristics. Consider: system status visibility, real-world language matching, user control and freedom, consistency, error prevention, recognition over recall, flexibility, minimalist design, error recovery, and help documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Focused assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit the [specific area] for visual hierarchy, interaction patterns, and content clarity. Identify the top 3 issues and suggest concrete improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Comparison audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare the current [feature] against [standard/best practice]. Highlight gaps and recommend alignment improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Full audit with report
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete UX audit of [feature/page]. Include: summary score, heuristic scores table, critical issues list, prioritized recommendations table, and positive patterns observed. Format the output in markdown.

output_examples.output:
## UX Audit: Login Page

### Summary Score: Fair

### Heuristic Scores
| Heuristic | Score | Key Issue |
|-----------|-------|----------|
| System status | 4 | Loading state visible |
| User control | 2 | No password visibility toggle |
| Error recovery | 3 | Error messages clear but placement poor |

### Critical Issues
- Password field lacks visibility toggle
- Error messages appear after submit only

### Recommendations
| Priority | Issue | Recommendation | Effort |
|----------|-------|----------------|--------|
| P0 | Password visibility | Add show/hide toggle | Low |
| P1 | Error timing | Validate on blur | Medium |

## UX Audit: Checkout Flow

### Summary Score: Poor

### Critical Issues
- Cart icon not clickable
- No confirmation between steps

### Positive Patterns
- Progress indicator clear
- Form labels descriptive

best_practices: Start audits with high-traffic or high-impact areas first
Use the structured output format for consistency and actionability
Combine with accessibility-check skill for comprehensive quality assurance
anti_patterns: Auditing without clear criteria or framework
Focusing only on aesthetics over usability fundamentals
Skipping the heuristic evaluation for speed

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No, this skill only analyzes and reports findings. It does not modify any code or design files.

faq.question: What heuristics does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses Nielsen's 10 usability heuristics, the industry standard for heuristic evaluation.

faq.question: Can this skill test actual users?
faq.answer: No, this skill analyzes the interface design. For user testing, combine it with journey-map for flow context.

faq.question: How long does an audit take?
faq.answer: A basic audit takes seconds. A comprehensive audit with all heuristics may take a few minutes for complex features.

faq.question: Does this skill check accessibility?
faq.answer: No, use the accessibility-check skill for WCAG compliance. This skill focuses on general usability.

faq.question: What input does this skill need?
faq.answer: Provide a description of the interface, feature, or page. Include screenshots or mockups if available.
